statement.p: Explain why the vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -2 \\ -2 \\ -4 \\ 4 \\ 3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 0 \\ -1 \\ -3 \\ 2 \\ 4 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -5 \\ 2 \\ 3 \\ -2 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 4 \\ -1 \\ -5 \\ -1 \\ -5 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -2 \\ 2 \\ -1 \\ -5 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] are or are not a basis of \mathbb{R}^5

answer.p: The vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -2 \\ -2 \\ -4 \\ 4 \\ 3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 0 \\ -1 \\ -3 \\ 2 \\ 4 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -5 \\ 2 \\ 3 \\ -2 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 4 \\ -1 \\ -5 \\ -1 \\ -5 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -2 \\ 2 \\ -1 \\ -5 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] are a basis of \mathbb{R}^5.
